title: Where can I copyright my own music for free? - Quora

response.answer_text: By recording it on a material carrier. By delivering a score and text. By compiling a write-up. No money needed. Just that. License companies make money out of the believe that you can’t do that for free and always need an approval of a “higher instance”. But that is not true.

You automatically own copyright protections on music you create. That's free. If you want additional protections, you need to register your copyrights at the Copyright Office in your country. That's cheap, but not free.
